58ca773b44b4b.Name: LLP011 List adddresses to select from
58ca773b44b4b.Output_template:
{"systemID":"59a4f21090a7f","systemName":"Firmstep Solutions Read","lookup_validation":"0","results_page_columns_db":"","secure_fields_db_database":"","escapeTokens":"yes","query":"select CONCAT(trim(concat(sao,' ',pao)),' ',street_name,', ',town_name) as display, uprn as name
FROM llpgcache
WHERE 
(
(REPLACE(postcode, ' ','') = REPLACE({postcode_search_after},' ',''))
OR (concat(trim(concat(sao,' ',pao)),' ',street_name) like concat('%',{postcode_search_after},'%'))
)
AND length(REPLACE({postcode_search_after},' ',''))>5
AND postcode != ''
ORDER BY CAST(pao AS SIGNED),sao,street_name ASC LIMIT 300"}

58ca6c233f02c.Name: LLP015 Selected value to fields
58ca6c233f02c.Output_template:
{"systemID":"59a4f21090a7f","systemName":"Firmstep Solutions Read","lookup_validation":"0","results_page_columns_db":"","secure_fields_db_database":"","escapeTokens":"yes","query":"select
	sao as flat_out,
	pao as house_out,
	street_name as street_out,
	town_name as town_out, 
	postcode as postcode_out5,
	uprn as uprn_out,
	lng as lng_out,
	lat as lat_out,
	{Choose_Address} as uprn_selected
FROM 
	llpgcache
WHERE 
	uprn = {Choose_Address}"}

58ca9f8575eb5.Name: PRO010 Load Profile info to SFG Cust Details
58ca9f8575eb5.Output_template:
{"systemID":"59a4f21090a7f","systemName":"Firmstep Solutions Read","lookup_validation":"0","results_page_columns_db":"","secure_fields_db_database":"","escapeTokens":"yes","query":"select * From
(select
	1 as IDZZ,
	1 as existSelected,
	1 as existingCustomer,
	{Organisation_Name} as Organisation_Name_out,
	{Title} as Title_out,
	{First_Name} as First_Name_out,
	{Surname} as Surname_out,
	{flat} as flat_out,
	{house} as house_out,
	{street} as street_out,
	{town} as town_out, 
	if({country} IS NOT NULL and {country} != '' and {country} != 'United Kingdom','',{postcode}) as postcode_out5,
	if({country} IS NOT NULL and {country} != '' and {country} != 'United Kingdom',{postcode},'') as zIPPostcode,
	{country} as country_out,
	{country_id} as sel_country,
	{uprn} as uprn_out,
	{lng} as lng_out,
	{lat} as lat_out,
	{Date_of_Birth} as Date_of_Birth_out,
	{Email_Address} as Email_Address_out,
	{Mobile_Number} as Mobile_Number_out,
	{Phone_Number} as Phone_Number_out,
	'ProAi' as haveRun
union select
	2 as IDZZ,
	'' as existSelected,
	'' as existingCustomer,
	{Organisation_Name} as Organisation_Name_out,
	{Title} as Title_out,
	{First_Name} as First_Name_out,
	{Surname} as Surname_out,
	'' as flat_out,
	'' as house_out,
	'' as street_out,
	'' as town_out, 
	'' as postcode_out5,
	'' as zIPPostcode,
	'' as country_out,
	'' as sel_country,
	'' as uprn_out,
	'' as lng_out,
	'' as lat_out,
	{Date_of_Birth} as Date_of_Birth_out,
	{Email_Address} as Email_Address_out,
	{Mobile_Number} as Mobile_Number_out,
	{Phone_Number} as Phone_Number_out,
	'ProAe' as haveRun) Combine
Where
	IDZZ = (select if({subParm} like '%dA%' 
			and {subParm} not like '%oNA%'
			and {postcode} is not null ,1,2) as test)"}

58cac46f269a2.Name: LLP017 Change to Use Customer Recorded
58cac46f269a2.Output_template:
{"systemID":"59a4f21090a7f","systemName":"Firmstep Solutions Read","lookup_validation":"0","results_page_columns_db":"","secure_fields_db_database":"","escapeTokens":"yes","query":"select
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {flat}, '') as flat_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {house}, '') as house_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {street}, '') as street_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {town}, '') as town_out, 
	IF(({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%')
		and ({country} IS NULL or {country} = '' or {country} = 'United Kingdom')), {postcode}, '') as postcode_out5,
	IF(({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%')
		and ({country} IS NOT NULL and {country} != '' and {country} != 'United Kingdom')), {postcode}, '') as zIPPostcode,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {country}, '') as country_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {uprn}, '') as uprn_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {lng}, '') as lng_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), {lat}, '') as lat_out,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), 1, '') as existSelected,
 IF({existingCustomer} = 1 or ({subParam} like '%dA%' and {haveRun} like '%Ae%'), 1, '') as existingCustomer,
 'ProcAi' as haveRun"}

58efbd46c0cbd.Name: LLP018 Confirm the entered address
58efbd46c0cbd.Output_template: {"systemID":"59a4f21090a7f","systemName":"Firmstep Solutions Read","query":"select a.*, if(b.p1 + b.p2 + b.p3 - b.p4 > 2,'Entered','') as uprn_selected, if(b.p1 + b.p2 + b.p3 - b.p4 > 2,'',1) as Address_Found, if(b.p1 + b.p2 + b.p3 - b.p4 > 2,'',concat(if(b.p1 + b.p2 + b.p3 < 3,'The address must contain a flat or house number, road and postcode. ',''),if(b.p4 = 1,' The postcode must contain a space, for e.g. "PO1 2AL"',''))) as confMsg, '' as confirmAddress, b.* from (select 123 as id, {flat_out1} as flat_out, {house_out1} as house_out, {street_out1} as street_out, {town_out1} as town_out, {postcode_out51} as postcode_out5, {zIPPostcode1} as zIPPostcode, {country_out1} as country_out, {sel_country} as country_id_out, '' as uprn_out, '' as lng_out, '' as lat_out, '' as existSelected, '' as existingCustomer) as a RIGHT JOIN (select if(c.p1 + c.p2 + c.p3 - c.p4 > 2,'123','321') as id, c.* from (select if({flat_out1} != '' or {house_out1} != '',1,if({subParam} like '%mAd%',0,1)) as p1, if({street_out1} != '',1,if({subParam} like '%mAd%',0,1)) as p2, if({postcode_out51} != '' or {zIPPostcode1} != '',1,if({subParam} like '%mAd%' or {subParam} like '%mPo%',0,1)) as p3, if({postcode_out51} REGEXP '(((^[BEGLMNSbeglmns][1-9][0-9]?)|(^[Ww][2-9])|(^([Aa][BLbl]|[Bb][ABDHLNRSTabnhlnrst]|[Cc][ABFHMORTVWabfhmortvw]|[Dd][ADEGHLNTYadeghlnty]|[Ee][HNXhnx]|[Ff][KYky]|[Gg][LUYluy]|[Hh][ADGPRSUXadgprsux]|[Ii][GMPVgmpv]|[JEje]|[Kk][ATWYatwy]|[Ll][ADELNSUadelnsu]|[Mm][EKLekl]|[Nn][EGNPRWegnprw]|O[LXlx]|[Pp][AEHLORaehlor]|[Rr][GHMghm]|[Ss][AEGKL-Paegkl-pRSTWYrstwy]|[Tt][ADFNQRSWadfnqrsw]|[Uu][Bb]|[Ww][ADFNRSVadfnrsv]|YO|ZE|yo|ze)[0-9][0-9]?)|(^[Ww]1[A-Ha-hJKSTUWjkstuw0-9])|(((^[Ww][Cc][1-2])|(^[Ee][Cc][1-4])|(^[Ss][Ww]1))[ABEHMNPRVWXYabehmnprvwxy]))[_ ]([0-9][ABD-Habd-hJLNP-Ujlnp-uW-Zw-z]{2}))$|(^[Gg][Ii][Rr][_ ]0[Aa]{2})$',0,if({postcode_out51} != '',1,0)) as p4) as c) as b ON a.id = b.id","results_page_columns_db":"","secure_fields_db_database":"","escapeTokens":"yes"}

props.label: staticText 1
props.content:
Please complete the event application form as fully as possible. We need this information before we can consider any event to be held on council land and to ensure that your event will be run safely and sensibly, follows all legal and licensing requirements, that the venue you want to use is available, and that it will not clash with other city activities.

As a part of the application you will be required to upload the following key documents:

  • A copy of your public liability insurance certificate
  • A risk assessment
  • A site plan with a clear illustration of the layout of your event

We cannot accept requests with less than 3 weeks' notice. If you are holding your event on a public highway or road, and therefore, require a road closure, then at least 12 weeks' notice is required. This allows enough time for the legal process to be completed.

If we don't receive the forms and all paperwork in time, your application may not be processed.

A hire fee and deposit are required to use Portsmouth City Council land. The cost of holding an event in Portsmouth varies depending on the location, duration and nature of the event. Costs will be discussed with you during the application process.

For help completing this form or further information, please visit our Events webpage and read our guidance notes, or email events@portsmouthcc.gov.uk

props.label: html 29
props.content: {#GDPR}

props.label: html 18
props.content:
This information will only be used to seek permission for your proposed event and will not be shared with any organisation outside of the application process.

.

props.label: staticText 3
props.content:
Balloon Releases

In an attempt to protect the environment and wildlife, balloon releases are prohibited from Portsmouth City Council land, including schools where they agree. The Council would advise you to consider other methods of fundraising and remembrance. For further advice, contact https://www.nabas.co.uk/balloons-and-releases/

Chinese Lanterns

In an attempt to protect the environment and wildlife and to prevent any damage from fire, the release of Chinese Lanterns is prohibited from Portsmouth City Council land, including schools where they agree

props.label: html 8
props.content: Animals

props.label: html 6
props.content:
Portsmouth City Council will not permit mobile petting zoos, static exhibitions or the sale of animals (which includes invertebrates, reptiles and fish, excluding working animals) at any events on City Council land, or on any sites where a venue is operated on behalf of the City Council, irrespective of whether appropriate documentation is available or not.

The exception to this would be Cumberland House Natural History Museum and Butterfly House, Blue Reef Aquarium, schools or similar where the main role of the venue is for educational or conservation purposes, and that it can be demonstrated that all appropriate measures have been put in place to safeguard the well-being of the animals, invertebrates and insects on display there.

Before answering the next questions you must read: Portsmouth City Council's Animals at Events Policy.

props.maximumChoicesMessage: Please select no more than _max_value_ choices
props.label: I confirm that I have read PCC's Animals at Events Policy
What animals are you proposing to involve in your event?
props.maximumLengthMessage: Please input no more than _max_value_ characters
props.validationMaskMessage: Please input text of the format: _validation_mask_

props.label: Why are the animals needed at the event?
props.maximumLengthMessage: Please input no more than _max_value_ characters
props.validationMaskMessage: Please input text of the format: _validation_mask_

props.label: To support your application for animals at your event, please submit a veterinary certificate, risk assessment, animal welfare policy and animal welfare act licence /zoo licence.  All paperwork must fully and appropriately demonstrate that the welfare of the animals has been considered and secured when performing, at rest and when in transit to the event.

props.label: html 15
props.content:
All ride or inflatable operators must carry the appropriate certification for their equipment. For fairground rides this is called ADIPS. For inflatable play equipment this is called PIPA. All equipment must be operated in accordance with the manufacturer's instructions and by suitably trained persons.

Please confirm that ADIPS/PIPA documentation has been obtained and that the equipment will be operated by the company supplying it.

For further information on ADIPS head to:http://adips.co.uk/

For further information on the PIPA scheme head to: https://www.pipa.org.uk
props.displayCondition: {otherActivities} icontains 'Childrens or juveniles rides / attractions' or {otherActivities} icontains 'Inflatable e.g. bouncy castle'

props.label: staticText 16
props.content:
An event that requires a road closure or diversion will require a temporary traffic regulation order from the local authority.

You will need to allow at least 12 weeks before your event for this to be in place if the closure is agreed. There will be a fee charged for this service by the traffic management team, for which the event organiser is liable. The traffic management team will assess your application and confirm charges with you.

props.label: html 19
props.content:
A street party that requires a road closure or diversion will require a temporary traffic regulation order from the local authority.

You will need to allow at least 12 weeks before your event for this to be in place if the closure is agreed. There will be a fee charged for this service by the traffic management team, for which the event organiser is liable. The traffic management team will assess your application and confirm charges with you.

props.label: Do you require a road closure or rolling road closure?
props.helpText: A charge will be made for closing a road and restricting parking.  The Traffic Management Team will assess your application and confirm charges with you.

props.label: html 22
props.content:
Please download and complete the following TTRO application form.

Please produce a traffic management plan and submit with your TTRO application form.

Guidance notes for completing the TTRO application form

Guidance notes for completing traffic management plan.

Once signed and dated, these documents should be sent to tania.almond@portsmouthcc.gov.uk

Should you require further assistance please contact Tania Almond on 023 9283 4067 or tania.almond@portsmouthcc.gov.uk

props.label: html 3
props.content:
Event Organisers are required to hold a current (in date at the time of the event) policy of insurance relevant to the activity being organised in respect of Public Liability or Third Party risks (including products liability where appropriate).

Providing Employer's Liability only is not acceptable. The indemnity amount needs to be approved by the council's Risk and Insurance Department. Under no circumstances will this be less than 5 million. The council reserves the right to require a higher limit if necessary.

If unavailable when applying, evidence of relevant insurance cover must be provided at least 10 days before the event for approval to be given.

props.label: html 23
props.content: Event organisers are advised to take out public liability insurance to the amount of 5 million.

props.label: Do you have public liability insurance?
Please give details of the value of your cover (in millions)

props.label: staticText 20
props.content: Risk assessments

props.label: html 16
props.content: Risk assessments are a legal requirement and should be carried out for each event. A risk assessment details the methods you will employ to minimise any identified risks associated with your event. Please refer to the Health & Safety Executive online for guidance on writing a risk assessment, here you will find examples, and templates: http://www.hse.gov.uk/risk/

props.label: html 24
props.content: Portsmouth City Council requires street party organisers to produce a risk assessment. A risk assessment details the methods you will employ to minimise any identified risks associated with your street party.

props.label: Do you have risk assessments for your event?

props.label: Please upload a security plan for the event (Word doc, PDF or JPG)
props.helpText: Your security plan should detail the numbers of security staff, and stewards, their roles, how they are managed, briefings, shift times and how they will be deployed across your event site.  Any security staff used must be Security Industry Authority (SIA) trained and licensed. You should provide information of what level of training the staff have.  As an event organiser, you will need to be aware of the SIA requirements for the employment of security & stewarding at your event.     For further information: https://www.sia.homeoffice.gov.uk/Pages/home.aspx

props.label: html 26
props.content:
You will need to identify a group of people who can assist you at the event as needed. Some examples of tasks they might be needed for include:
  • Putting in place road closure and diversion signage if applicable.
  • If residents need to move their vehicle during the event, they will need to be escorted at no more than 5mph.
  • If an emergency vehicle requires access, any structures or furniture will need to be moved to allow easy access.
  • At the end of the event, to ensure all rubbish is removed from the street.
  • Removal of road closure and diversion signage once the street is clear again at the end of the party.
I confirm that I will identify a group of people to assist as necessary:

props.maximumChoicesMessage: Please select no more than _max_value_ choices
props.label: Confirm
html 12
props.content:
You must consult all properties that will be affected by the street party and its road closure.

This consultation should take place by letter using this template.

props.label: html 14
props.content: You must forward us details of any objection you receive as you become aware of it. Most objections are then resolved through discussion between the objector, organiser(s), and occasionally a council officer. If you receive any rejections please contact Tania Almond, 023 9283 4067 or email: tania.almond@portsmouthcc.gov.uk to make arrangements.

props.label: Are all staff dealing with lost children and vulnerable adults DBS checked?
staticText 30
props.content: Please note, if you don't have a procedure in place you may use the Lost children and vulnerable adults reporting procedure and form in the Events guidance notes on our event planning page.

props.label: html 27
props.content:
Street party organisers need to ensure measures are put in place so the event is fully accessible for all residents including those who may be vulnerable or have disabilities.

Street party organisers must ensure access is maintained to properties where residents have additional needs, e.g carers, meal deliveries, midwives, health visitors etc.

Street party organisers should ensure parents maintain responsibility for their children.

I confirm that these measures will be implemented

props.maximumChoicesMessage: Please select no more than _max_value_ choices
props.label: Confirm
staticText 28
props.content:
You need to ensure that adequate sanitary provision is made for the number of people expected to attend your event.

Where possible, locate toilets at different points around the venue rather than in just one area to minimise crowding and queuing problems.

The Event Industry Forum's Purple Guide contains further guidance. Its general guidelines for toilet provision are as follows, but will vary depending on the type of event and level of drink consumption:

For an event with an opening time of more than six hours, a toilet per 100 females ,a toilet per 500 males, plus a urinal per 150 males.

For an event with an opening time of less than six hours, a toilet per 120 females, a toilet per 600 males, plus a urinal per 175 males.

props.label: Will public toilets be available at the venue for the duration of the event?
Have you have arranged for any out of hours opening?
Do you intend to provide additional portable toilets?
How many?
props.minimumValueMessage: Please input _min_value_ or more
props.maximumValueMessage: Please input _max_value_ or less

props.label: html 30
props.content:
One of the council's priorities is to make our City cleaner, safer and greener.

With this in mind, please consider how you will make your event more sustainable, this may include:

  • Reducing plastic consumption
  • Encouraging participants to use public transport
  • Consider using local event suppliers
  • Consider having recycling facilities available
  • Consider hiring portable water drinking butts

props.label: Please provide details on how the area will be kept free of litter and rubbish, and whether you intend to offer recycling facilities, with contact details for any contractors you intend to use.
props.maximumLengthMessage: Please input no more than _max_value_ characters
props.validationMaskMessage: Please input text of the format: _validation_mask_

props.label: html 2
props.content:
All litter must be removed and disposed of by the organiser. No litter bags can be left next to existing bins.

Alternatively, a contractor can be hired by the organiser to take rubbish away. Please contact Colas on telephone: 023 9231 0900 email: pfi@colas.co.uk to make arrangements.

props.label: Please provide details of how rubbish will be removed after the event
props.maximumLengthMessage: Please input no more than _max_value_ characters
props.validationMaskMessage: Please input text of the format: _validation_mask_

props.label: html 10
props.content:
As the organiser, you will be responsible for clearing of all waste and equipment from the street at the end of the event. As the event is a community event organised by residents and attended by residents within the street, the waste on this occasion will be treated as household waste. The house holders will therefore have to take the waste home with them and it will be collected on the normal day when waste is collected from their home. The cleaning of the street will be covered by the existing contract and at the usual scheduled time.

If you hire a catering unit, you must ensure that they dispose of the waste they create in line with the food and catering standards authority.

Further information is available here

html 17
props.content: You must ensure all contractors and catering concessions at the event comply with current health and safety regulations and food safety legislation and will have provided you with up to date public liability insurance, risk assessments, inspection certificates and method statements in relation to this event. See sections 11, 15, 16 and 17 in Terms and Conditions.

props.label: staticText 24
props.content:
Your application cannot be submitted if you fail to provide relevant up-to-date documentation

Please attach the following documents:

props.label: staticText 25
props.content:
Please ensure that all documentation contains as much information as possible - if the information is inadequate it may take longer to process your application, and the event may be unable to go ahead.

The organisers will have plans and procedures in place to deal with the following:

  • Crowd Management
  • Emergencies and evacuations
  • First aid
  • Lost children and vulnerable adults
  • Security and stewarding
  • Toilet provision
  • Traffic management
  • Waste management and litter collection

props.label: html 4
props.content: I hereby confirm that I have read, understood and agree to comply with the Terms and conditions for holding an event on Portsmouth City Council land and the departmental terms and conditions of hire and all reasonable instructions given by any officers of Portsmouth City Council and representatives of other statutory services

props.label: html 5
props.content: I also understand my obligations and responsibilities with regard to the content of this application. I understand that failure to comply with any of Terms and conditions for holding an event on Portsmouth City Council land may result in the cancellation of the event by the council. In addition, I agree to inform the council of any proposed changes to the information contained within this application.
